author: sussman
msg: Note need for 'svn revert':  we can just copy the SVN/text-base/ file
back out into the working copy, no repository communication necessary.

author: sussman
msg: Make the fs-commit editor match the subpooling/reference-counting
behavior of the wc-update editor.  This allows efficient memory usage
(an independent pool for each dir and file baton), as well as allowing
the editor to be driven in a postfix-text-delta-ey way.
(struct dir_baton):  add ref_count and subpool fields.
(replace_root, add_directory, replace_directory): create a subpool of
parent's pool, allocate new dir_baton in there.
(change_file_prop, change_dir_prop):  duh, use baton's own subpool.

author: kfogel
msg: (dir_deltas): Revert 1.65->1.66 change; i.e., don't use subpools.  The
change didn't fix my bug, and anyway the subpools weren't really
addressing the intensive pool usage in the innermost loop.

author: sussman
msg: More things to discuss next week.
